p: From an anatomical point of view, fruits are composed of a seed and the pericarp (exocarp). The first includes flesh and seed coat, while the second comprises three different parts called exocarp or epicarp (the outer layer of the fruit), mesocarp (the middle part) and endocarp (inside layer). The layers of the pericarp are not distinguishable in dry fruits such as walnut. Thus, it is thought that the husk is both the exocarp and mesocarp, and the shell portion is the endocarp. The enclosed kernel with skin is the walnut seed ( Figure 1).
